metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15466 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.4, the GVCP dissector could go into an infinite loop. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-gvcp.c by ensuring that an offset increases in all situations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.5-1
libwireshark14 - 3.2.5-1
libwiretap11 - 3.2.5-1
libwsutil12 - 3.2.5-1
tshark - 3.2.5-1
wireshark - 3.2.5-1
wireshark-common - 3.2.5-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.5-1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.5-1').
